name: Crieff Hydro Hotel and Resort

reviews.text: Crief is a great family hotel, with just a couple of drawbacks to watch out for, but with a bit of planning you could have a great break. We are a family of 4 with two young children (5 and 7), and these are the pros and cons of our trip:
reviews.title: Ideal family stay - with a bit of tweaking

reviews.text: A nice grand feel about the hotel, lots of space to roam
reviews.title: Generally good

reviews.text: Fine choice of dining for both parents and children from the formal to the more relaxed; with a hotel of this size there is always going to be a bit of a production line going on in the dining experience, but they run a pretty slick operation.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, but small rooms!

reviews.text: The Kids club and childcare are fantastic, we've stayed in a few of the well known family friendly hotels, our children would say this was probably the best one, they loved the kids club and the family entertainment afterwards, this was the big winner for us.
reviews.title: Great for families and seniors, but some important let-downs

reviews.text: The staff are great, really friendly and helpful
reviews.title: Great family break

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel over the last 45 years, first with my parents, then my children, my wife's 50th birthday and now with my grand-children. We had a slight issue on arrival over what we thought we had booked in terms of self catering but the management went out of their way to make our stay outstanding. Great staff - wonderful faciities - during the summer very much a family holiday.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: I visited this hotel/resort for 3 nights to celebrate a 70th birthday - the whole family attended,aged 5 months to 70yrs and there was something for everyboday. The older children loved 'Big Country' the very well run section which 'babysits' children - they can also eat there whilst their parents dine in the elegant dining room.
reviews.title: A thoroughly pleasant experience

reviews.text: The food was delicious and the service impeccable.
reviews.title: An ideal luxury family break with loads of activities

reviews.text: All the staff were very friendly and made you feel very welcome.
reviews.title: Fantastic family break!

reviews.text: There were so many activities it was difficult to fit them in! I would love to go again!
reviews.title: An national treasure for family holidays

reviews.text: We made a late booking for a family standard room and the website virtual tour had indicated that we could expect a double bed and a single bed. On our arrival we found that a small put-up bed had been added to a double room which was not really adequate for a 15 year old.
reviews.title: Good 'not so clean' fun.

reviews.text: On the whole the hydro offered excellent facilities, welcoming and very helpful staff and a suberb weekend (we are a couple with a 15 year old and a one year old). We found the weekend to be good value as breakfast and dinner were included.
reviews.title: My home away from home!

likes.liked: — Clean close to riding school and golf corse
likes.disliked: — Really annoying into lounge which i feel over and hit my head and knee!

reviews.text: One downside was that it took several attempts at the buffet breakfast to find a clean cereal bowl from the self service stack and when I was provided with a high chair the tray was covered in the last users food, when I asked the waiter if he would clean it he used a cloth that looked as though it was used to clean the floors. Some of the dining room furniture looked very tired against the otherwise 'posh' interior.
reviews.title: Be aware of their terms and conditions

likes.disliked: — Customer service and Terms and conditions

reviews.text: Well I just got Back from Crieff on Saturday morning, and wish i was still there, although i am going tomorrow for horse riding.
reviews.title: Great family resort

likes.liked: — High standards and great kids club
likes.disliked: — Food could be improved but generally OK

reviews.text: Now this comment is from a 14 year olds perspective! I have been going on holiday to crieff for as long as i can remember, my mum has been going since she was about 9, so this is very much a tradition in my family. About two years ago after coming back from crieff i decided i wanted to have my weekly riding lessons there as i love the horses and the instructors are great, it made my regular riding school look mediocre. Now some may say coming up every week would ruin it when i came on holiday but it didnt, in fact it did the opposite, it made me look forward to it more.
reviews.title: Enjoyable visit to a good hotel

likes.liked: — Beautiful location and a nice hotel
likes.disliked: — The restuarants were ok but not quite as good as they should have been.

reviews.text: This hotel is great. We had an executive family room with view, it had 5 beds in it and was not crowded. The food was delicious, the grounds and gardens wonderful, the lagoon pool excellent - and not crowded.
reviews.title: Just wonderful
Watch out for Non-refundable deposit scam
reviews.text: As for the childcare well it was just too good to be true. Well organised with trained staff and the facilities were excellent.
I cannot rate this hotel highly enough!
reviews.title: Great family break

reviews.text: Dear All,
reviews.title: Family Fun

reviews.text: Please watch out when you book this hotel!!!!! Our company reserved a room by telephone at the Crieff Hydro. We then had to cancel the reservation due to some unforeseen circumstanses that our client experienced. When cancelling the room over 30 days prior to the arrival date they then decided to tell us that they would be taking £10 per night per person for the whole stay as a non-refundable deposit. Having checked the confirmation of the booking there were no terms and conditions explaining this nor is it displayed on their website!!!! The way they have dealt with our complaint has been disgusting and I would not advise anyone to book this hotel until they change their policys. Not to mention that the staff sends out emails with wrong numbers just so that you can't call them direct and clarify anything. If you do decide to book anyway....make sure you don't become ill as you will be paying for it!
reviews.title: Content (eventually) in Crieff

likes.liked: — Great childcare and variety of activities available

reviews.text: Crieff Hydro does not know what it wants to be. The place is more akin to Butlins with posh accommodation than a four/five star spa resort:
reviews.title: Doesn't know what it wants to be....

likes.liked: — Excellent for younger children (not below the age of three)
likes.disliked: — Overpriced, poor upkeep of some facilities and far too many people there!

reviews.text: The hotel is very grand, in a 150 year old fashion (there is a major refit going on, with the refurbished rooms and bathrooms very tastefully done).
reviews.title: Good Family Holiday

reviews.text: It markets itself as a spa resort, with many facilities and activities on offer. The marketing information is very glossy and makes it look ideal for a luxury spa break for the ladies and, for the men, a spa resort mixed with high-adrenaline activities (4x4 off road driving, shooting, mountain biking, etc.
reviews.title: Ideal for families

reviews.text: HOWEVER:
reviews.title: Disappointing break
Good Ballroom
reviews.text: The hotel is awash with families with young children BECAUSE of the many family friendly facilities (partly why we went there wit our 15 month old boy). This in itself is no major detraction, but if you expect a quiet relaxing time DO NOT GO HERE !!!
Just returned from a three night stay at the Hydro, early November.
reviews.title: Scottish "fandabidosi" hotel

likes.liked: — Very clean and nicely refurbished despite being a very old building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is fantastic - check-in very quick and pleasant and the room was huge for two of us.
reviews.title: Distinctly average. Overpriced.

likes.disliked: — Too many children running around the hotel. Expensive.

reviews.text: The hotel is full of nice little extras - snooker room, cinema, nooks and crannies along the corridors where you can sit and read a book and while away a pleasant hour or two.
reviews.title: What a Expensive Mistake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had evening dinner included in the Meikle Restaurant and the food was superb - beautifully presented and great service. Breakfast was buffet, but not at all bad and no long wait for tables despite the hotel being very busy.
reviews.title: Loved it

likes.liked: — Range of things to do, good food nice surroundings

reviews.text: The grounds are just fantastic - full of autumn coloured leaves, nice quiet walks and stunning views over the hills.
reviews.title: Ideal for large families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I staged our wedding reception at Crieff Hydro in July 2011 and the whole day was perfect. Rosalyn Crawford, the wedding co-ordinator. was a great help in organising the reception and made sure every little details was taken care of. Stuart was the MC and main man on the day itself, ensuring all the guests were taken care of and that everything ran smoothly.
reviews.title: Wedding at Crieff Hydro

reviews.text: We had our wedding breakfast in the beautiful Drawing Room, which easily sat our 160 guests, and the evening reception downstairs in the Ferntower Suite. Both rooms were beautifully decorated for the occassion. The food for both the wedding breakfast and the evening buffet was fantastic, and since the wedding guests have commented that it was of a higher standard than the 'usual' wedding fayre.
reviews.title: unimpressed

reviews.text: The honeymoon suite we stayed in was very large with a seperate lounge and bedroom. The staff had kindly transferred all our wedding gifts to our bedroom, presumably, while the evening reception was ongoing, so we didnt have to run around chasing anything the next day. Champagne and strawberries were also provided when we finally decided to retire for the night.
reviews.title: Good for the family get together.

reviews.text: Thanks to all at Crieff who helped make our special day such a success, and gave us absolutely nothing to worry about on what could have been a very stressful day. We will be back
reviews.title: We loved it as per previous visits and we'll be back !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this for a 3 night break, executive family room costing £660 on a DBB rate for 2 adults & 1 child. Talk about a complicated eating plan???!!!! Our little boy could eat with us at breakfast in the Meikle, but for his evening meal, we were told he could have a high tea at the Brasserie which meant he would eat on his own??? We chose to have him eat with us, which we were charged for!!! Afterall it was a family break, and wanted my child to eat with his mom & dad!!!! Poor service at breakfast, no coffee or toast at the table!! Buffet trays were empty most of the time.
reviews.title: Dont recommend this hotel at all- a genuine let down for the price

reviews.text: the Hydro was the venue for our wedding in july and we had the pleasue of 2 nights stay after the wedding.
reviews.title: such a fantastic wedding

reviews.text: Our wedding was the most fantastic day the events staff were so helpfull in the run up to the wedding and on the day goin above and beyond the call of duty. They even let us store our un arranged flowers as it was so warm that they were wilting.
reviews.title: Great Family Hotel! Really caters to children too!

reviews.text: our wedding meal was great and the service fantastic.
reviews.title: Great for a Wedding

reviews.text: We were also pleasantly suprised to find that the hotel bar had a DJ on a friday night and therefore our celbrations could continue late in to the night well after our own DJ had gone home.
reviews.title: Conned!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was lovely with a nice jacuzzi bath (the lomond suite) and plenty of rooms for all the wedding stuff..clothing presents etc.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Staff very relaxing

description: Arguably the most comprehensive family resort in Scotland, 4 star Crieff Hydro is centrally located in its own 900 acre estate with an unrivaled range of leisure pursuits for all ages. Choose from over 40 on-site leisure activities and take advantage of inclusive daily childcare for 2-12 year olds in the 700m2 kids club. Extensively redeveloped from top to bottom, Crieff Hydro is only an hours drive from both Glasgow and Edinburgh.
